statement:
The following theorem implies the essential uniqueness of splitting
fields and algebraic closures.

Let $\sigma:F\rightarrow F^\prime$ be an isomorphism of fields,
$S={\{f_\alpha:\alpha\in A\}}$ a set of non-constant polynomials in
$F[X]$, and $S^\prime={\{\sigma(f_\alpha):\alpha\in A\}}$ the
corresponding set of polynomials in $F^\prime[X]$. If $K$ is a splitting
field of $S$ over $F$ and $K^\prime$ a splitting field of $S^\prime$
over $F^\prime$, then $\sigma$ may be extended to an isomorphism of $K$
and $K^\prime$.

If $F$ is a field and $S$ a set of non-constant polynomials in $F[X]$,
then any two splitting fields of $S$ over $F$ are $F$-isomorphic. In
particular, any two algebraic closures of $F$ are $F$-isomorphic.
names: existence of extensions of field isomorphisms to splitting fields
